snippet: A proposal from Malaysia would allow health considerations to take precedence over expanded trade.
abstract: Editorial praises Malaysia for heading off an American effort to weaken the ability of countries to impose stiff rules on the sale of cigarettes and other tobacco products within their borders; notes that the issue led to a stalemate at the Trans-Pacific Partnership trade meeting; urges American trade officials to side with the public and those concerned about public health, not the makers of products known to be lethal and highly addictive.
lead_paragraph: A proposal from Malaysia would allow health considerations to take precedence over expanded trade.
